title: The Princess Of Bern
opening: There is a small village on the border of Pherae and Bern. This is where Roy is to meet the mercenary band that Eliwood hired.

Just east of the village is a small castle occupied by Bern's forces. At the time Roy reaches the village, the castle is in an outright panic. Roy has yet to realize that this confusion going on in the castle will spread, engulfing the entire continent of Elibe in chaos...

intro.speaker: Melady
intro.line: All I want to know is what happened to Princess Guinevere!

intro.speaker: Rude
intro.line: Y-yes, Captain Melady... I'm certain she was in her room this morning, but she simply vanished...

intro.speaker: Melady
intro.line: You told me that already, you buffoon! I don't want excuses! Are you so incompetent you can't understand that?!

intro.speaker: Rude
intro.line: Well... I... Er...

intro.speaker: Melady
intro.line: Our forces are mobilizing to begin a full-scale war with Lycia. How are we to focus on the battle if the princess is missing?! Naturally, you will take full responsibility for her disappearance.

intro.speaker: Melady
intro.line: I never should have let Her Highness come to the border to begin with. I will return to Bern and inform the king of this matter. I'll try not to cause a panic, but I can't promise your life if the princess isn't found. I trust you'll take every measure to locate her as soon as possible.

intro.speaker: Rude
intro.line: Yes, Captain!

intro.speaker: Rude
intro.line: Is Princess Guinivere secure?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Yes, Commander. She's under constant surveillance in the cellar.

intro.speaker: Rude
intro.line: Good. Don't let her escape.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: But Commander... are you sure this is a good idea?

intro.speaker: Rude
intro.line: Of course I'm sure! The younger sister of King Zephiel... We're sure to get a hefty sum turning her over to one of Bern's enemies.

intro.speaker: Rude
intro.line: Loyalty to one's king. Bah. What a worthless notion. The world is ruled by neither king nor queen. It's ruled by gold!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Yes, indubitably, Commander.... But there has been a snag, shall we say.

intro.speaker: Rude
intro.line: Hm? What do you mean?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: I just received a report... It seems that Princess Guinivere's lady-in-waiting has escaped...

intro.speaker: Rude
intro.line: What?! You lout, why didn't you say so earlier? Find her this instant! Don't let her get away!

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Lord Roy, this is the location.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: This is where we're supposed to meet the mercenaries?

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Yes, though it seems they aren't here yet. Wait, who's that? Somebody's coming this way...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Be careful there!

intro.speaker: Elen
intro.line: Oh, forgive me! I'm in such a hurry...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: No need for apologies. Are you hurt?

intro.speaker: Elen
intro.line: No, I'm fine. Thank you, good sir.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Farewell, then.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: I am. I am the son of Marquess Pherae.

intro.speaker: Elen
intro.line: Oh, Saint Elimine! Thank you for guiding me to this boy!

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Pardon?

intro.speaker: Elen
intro.line: Please, I need your help to rescue my mistress.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: What happened?

intro.speaker: Elen
intro.line: My name is Elen. I am a cleric of Saint Elimine. My mistress and I came from Bern to seek an audience with the lords of Lycia. However, Commander Rude of the castle east of here trapped us. We were captured, imprisoned by our own countrymen.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Lord Roy! We must avoid unnecessary entanglements with Bern!

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: But we can't neglect a noble of Bern who wants to speak with the lords of Lycia... Then again, we can't simply charge into enemy territory either... Wait, who's there?!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: There's the wench! Over here, boys! Get the girl! Our orders say dead or alive!

intro.speaker: Elen
intro.line: Oh dear...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Well, Merlinus, they provoked hostilities. I don't think we have any choice now.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: You wouldn't listen even if we did, I'm sure. But no matter. Let me witness all you've learned about tactics in Ostia.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: All right, everyone! We're going to charge the castle! Sister Elen, you should find a place to hide...

intro.speaker: Elen
intro.line: No, I will come with you. I cannot fight, but I can heal wounded allies.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: But...

intro.speaker: Elen
intro.line: I'm the one that got you tangled up in this mess. Please let me do what I can to help.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: OK, but just stay behind us so you aren't hurt.

intro.speaker: Elen
intro.line: Certainly. Thank you for the concern.

battle.speaker: Dieck
battle.line: They should be around here somewhere... Shanna, check around and try to find the soldiers from Pherae, will you?

battle.speaker: Wade
battle.line: So, Big Man, who's our client this time?

battle.speaker: Dieck
battle.line: House Pherae, one of the noble families of Lycia. The marquess's son is going to join the other armies of the Lycian League.

battle.speaker: Lot
battle.line: We're going up against Bern then?

battle.speaker: Wade
battle.line: Finally, a foe worthy of my axe! Let's show 'em what we're made of!

battle.speaker: Lot
battle.line: Bern, eh? This won't be easy, I can tell you that. We had best tread lightly.

battle.speaker: Shanna
battle.line: I think I've found them! But it looks like they're already caught up in a skirmish.

battle.speaker: Dieck
battle.line: What? The fighting's started already? Let's get a move on then. Time to earn our pay!

battle-talk.speaker: Dieck
battle-talk.line: Are you Lord Roy of House Pherae?

battle-talk.speaker: Dieck
battle-talk.line: Name's Dieck. You should've heard about me from an older man named Merlinus.

battle-talk.speaker: Roy
battle-talk.line: So you're the leader of the mercenary band?

battle-talk.speaker: Dieck
battle-talk.line: Just a small company, really. Sorry we're late. Didn't think the fighting would start so soon.

battle-talk.speaker: Dieck
battle-talk.line: Don't take it the wrong way. We don't blame you. Actually, quite the contrary. My boys are excited for a chance to show off their skills.

battle-talk.speaker: Roy
battle-talk.line: Brilliant. It sounds like you're just the caliber of fighters we need.

battle-talk.speaker: Dieck
battle-talk.line: Enough chitchat then. Let's wrap things up.

visit.speaker: Village
visit.line: Armored knights have nearly impenetrable defenses. But some weapons, like this sword, can pierce their armor. I'm sure you can get better use out of it than us. Please, take it.

visit.speaker: House
visit.line: Pegasi are useful for flying to hard-to-reach places. But woe to any rider who finds herself against an archer. An arrow can take a pegasus down in a single hit!

visit.speaker: House
visit.line: Forts are the key to a good defense. If you're in a fort, you can defend and even dodge more easily. On top of that, your wounds will heal slowly over time.

visit.speaker: House
visit.line: The weapon triangle... Swords, axes and lances. Remember, swords best axes, axes best lances, and lances best swords! Keep this in mind and things will be much easier for you!

boss.speaker: Rude
boss.line: Curse it all! Just when I thought things had finally turned my way...

boss.speaker: Rude
boss.line: Oof... Greed can only...bring you...an ill fate...

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Lord Roy! There was a woman locked in the cellar!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: That must be Elen's mistress. Bring her here.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Yes, milord.

end.speaker: Elen
end.line: Your Highness!

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: Elen! I'm so relieved you're well. You put yourself in such danger running off like you did... I worried myself sick about you.

end.speaker: Elen
end.line: I am sorry, Your Highness, but I couldn't leave you in that dank cellar...

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: Don't worry yourself, Elen. It's thanks to you I am safe now. I am in your debt. May I ask your name...?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I am Roy, son of Eliwood, Marquess Pherae.

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: It's a pleasure... As for myself...

end.speaker: Elen
end.line: Your Highness... Are you certain you should?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: Yes, Elen. It is fine. My name is Guinivere.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Guinivere?! That's the name of the Princess of Bern!

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: Yes, that is I.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: What?! This was a trap, wasn't it?!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Merlinus, hold.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: I beg your pardon, Lord Roy, but...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I wish to hear her out. Give her a chance, will you?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Tsk. As you will...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Are you truly Princess Guinivere from Bern?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: Yes, truly. I cannot blame you for doubting me, however.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Maybe you are the princess of Bern, and maybe you aren't. I can see from your actions and dress that you are at least of high status. If you are indeed Princess Guinivere, however, there's one thing I don't understand. Elen told me you intended to meet the lords of the Lycian League.

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: Yes, that is correct.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Why, if you are the sister of the King of Bern?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: I want to find a peaceful way to end the war. If I can speak to the Lycian council, I'm certain we can come to a solution.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Your brother instigated this war. Is it in your power to stop it?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: At the very least, I wish to do everything I can. No, I MUST do everything I can.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...I see. For the time being, come with us to meet the Lycian League armies. I want to see what Lord Hector thinks of this affair.

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: You will allow me to accompany you?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Yes. If there is any possibility to avoid further bloodshed, we must try. It matters not how small the chance.

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: Thank you! I truly am in your debt.
